alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Annette Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; City and Borough of Yakutat; City of Hyder; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 10:28PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...STORM FORCE FRONT MOVES IN WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY NIGHT... The second in a series of strong fronts moves over the AK Gulf then into the Panhandle Wednesday night into Thursday night. While this fast moving system will bring in periods of heavy precipitation and strong winds, it is not expected to be as severe as the system that impacted the region Tuesday. Precipitation will move in from west to east. Rainfall totals of 1 to 3 inches through Thursday night expected. Highest amounts along the Eastern Gulf Coast and Central Inner Channels. While snow will mix in with rain at times, accumulated snow limited to a few inches. Since rivers and stream levels were elevated from previous heavy rain, the additional rainfall will not take as long to bring these waterways to near bankful, however no flooding expected at this time. Southerly wind gusts peaking at 40 to 50 mph also expected late Wednesday night into Thursday evening. Stay tuned to the National Weather Service for updates at weather.gov/Juneau.
